name: sesB
otheraliases: Dmel_CG16944, A/A-T, A/A-T/sesB, ADP/ATP translocase, ADT2, ANT, ANT1, CG16944, Dmel\CG16944, EM12, Hmr, S12, SESB, SesB, anon-WO02059370.55, dANT, dSLC25A4, jive, l(1)9Ed, l(1)9Fa, l(1)DC701, l(1)EM31, l(1)G0126, l(1)G0247, l(1)G0386, l(1)S12, orangi, ses B, sesb
otherdesignations: stress-sensitive B|ADP,ATP carrier protein|CG16944-PA|CG16944-PB|CG16944-PC|CG16944-PD|CG16944-PE|Stress-sensitive B|adenine nuclear translocase|adenine nucleotide translocase|drosophila ANT|lethal(1)9Ed|sesB-PA|sesB-PB|sesB-PC|sesB-PD|sesB-PE|stress sensitive B|stress-sensitive
summary: Enables ATP:ADP antiporter activity. Involved in several processes, including determination of adult lifespan; intracellular calcium ion homeostasis; and muscle cell cellular homeostasis. Located in mitochondrial inner membrane. Is expressed in several structures, including adult head; adult heart; adult main segment of Malpighian tubule; adult midgut; and gonad. Used to study epilepsy and mitochondrial metabolism disease. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in intrinsic cardiomyopathy (multiple); mitochondrial DNA depletion syndrome (multiple); and mitochondrial myopathy (multiple). Orthologous to human SLC25A4 (solute carrier family 25 member 4); SLC25A5 (solute carrier family 25 member 5); and SLC25A6 (solute carrier family 25 member 6). [provided by Alliance of Genome Resources, Jul 2025]
